info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 1:59AM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL PRAIRIE AND NORTHWESTERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 159 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hazen, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Clarendon... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... Fredonia... Dobbs Landing... Peppers Landing... Hallsville... Screeton... Dagmar WMA... Tollville... Brasfield... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
